name: patter
content:
patter noun
(SPEECH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] continuous and sometimes funny speech or talk, especially used by someone trying to sell things or by an entertainer: He should succeed - he dresses well and his sales patter is slick and convincing.

patter noun
(SOUND)
[ S ] the sound of a lot of things gently and repeatedly hitting a surface: I find the patter of rain on the roof soothing.

patter noun [U]
(TALK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
fast, continuous talk, esp. that of an entertainer or someone trying to sell things: Phinizy’s clever patter kept his audience in a good mood.
patter noun [U]
(SOUND)
the sound of quick, light hits or steps: Now that she’s older, we have the patter of little feet in our hallways.
